questions.question_text: What are inputs and outputs in reference to a Playbook Development Lifecycle? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
Should be A, B, D

Selected Answer: BDE
I explained this as a comment below.

Selected Answer: BDE
Inputs reside in individual tasks, not in the entire playbook.

comments.content:
Yeah BDE is the right answer. 

Why B and not A? 
B. Inputs are data pieces that are present in the task: Inputs to a playbook are the data elements that tasks within the playbook require to operate. These can be specific pieces of information necessary for the execution of various tasks.

A. Inputs are data pieces that are present in the playbook: This is too broad and not specific to tasks or commands within the playbook.

choices.A: Inputs are data pieces that are present in the playbook
choices.C: Outputs are used as incident trigger for playbook
choices.D: Outputs can be derived from the result of a task or command
choices.E: Inputs are the data fields parsed by the Classifier
choices.B: Inputs are data pieces that are present in the task
Assign, Edit, and Mark as Duplicate for all selected incidents regardless of their status
choices.D: Export incidents as JSON and change incident status
choices.A: Run Command, Export, and Close and Delete for all selected incidents regardless of their status
choices.C: Run Command for all selected incidents having Active status

questions.question_text: Inside the Incidents table view, which actions can be performed on the selected incidents? (Choose two.)

comments.content: I agree with you on this.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
AB is correct
export only in csv

comments.content: This is not correct. Export only provides a csv. It's AB.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
CD is correct

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

choices.A: Go to the Marketplace > Download the Fix my XSOAR playbook pack > Run the playbook > Download logs from War Room
choices.B: Settings > About > Troubleshooting > Set Log Level to Debug > Download Logs

questions.question_text: An administrator has noticed that an integration has failed to fetch incidents. Where would they go to download logs to troubleshoot the error?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
main account acts as the central point where updates and content are first managed and reviewed before they are distributed.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
The pushed content should be first found in the main account before the tenants. Thus, the answer should be A.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

By default, the cache expires 4,320 minutes (3 days) after an indicator is updated

questions.question_text: To avoid exceeding API quotas for third-party services, indicators are only updated after the indicator cache expiration period. What is the default cache expiration period for indicators in XSOAR (minutes/days)?
